instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> with battery
threads.message:
Liquid damaged board.
After pressing power button on the keyboard its starts even after 30 seconds.
Most times pwr btn need to be pressed many many times to start.
Once started works OK.
When I restart then it boots without any issues.

Testing with:
Board only + DC + new battery.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> with connected charger and no battery is 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> with connected charger and with battery is showing random voltage from 0V to 5V, then multimeter freeze with flashing "Shock Hazard" led

Any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> with battery
threads.message: Disconnect battery. When connecting a power supply it should auto power on. If not disconnect keyboard and try again. Make sure your power supply is 60 or 85W.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> with battery
threads.message: Tested with 3 genuine 85W chargers with or without keyboard there is no auto power on

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> with battery
threads.message: Magsafe turning green and then orange? 3V present on L7560?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> with battery
threads.message:
Yes - green then orange.
3.3V on L7560

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> with battery
threads.message: Yeah suckage. Corrosion somewhere, the usual suspects apply: <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> area resistors traces, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, crap under SMC.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> with battery
threads.message: crap under SMC, SMC reflow and all works fine
